episode_title: 118 - The One With All The Poker
note: (The whole gang is helping Rachel mail out resumes while whistling the theme from The Bridge on the River Kwai.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Rach, we’re running low on resumes over here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you really want a job with Popular Mechanics ?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, if you’re gonna work for mechanics, those are the ones to work for.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, look, you guys, I’m going for anything here, OK? I cannot be a waitress anymore, I mean it. I’m sick of the lousy tips, I’m sick of being called ‘Excuse me…’

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, did you proofread these?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh… yeah, why?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, nothing, I’m sure they’ll be impressed with your excellent compuper skills.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my Goood! Oh, do you think it’s on all of them?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh no, I’m sure the Xerox machine caught a few.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are sitting at a table. Rachel is working. Monica and Phoebe enter.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, guys.

content.speaker: Chandler and Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey… hi, ladies… uh, can I get you anything? (to Monica, quietly): Did you bring the mail?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Lots of responses.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : Really? (out loud): Sure, we have scones left! (to Monica): OK, read them to me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: : Dear Ms. Green, thank you for your inquiry, however… oh… (crumples up letter)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : We have apple cinnamon…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: : OK… Dear Ms. Green… yeah… yeah… yeah… No. (crumpes up letter)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: : Your Visa bill is huge!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Give me that!
(Camera cuts to Chandler and Ross at table.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I can’t believe you. Linda is so great! Why won’t you go out with her again?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Is this still about her whole ‘The Flintstones could’ve really happened’ thing?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, it’s not just that. It’s just—I want someone who… who does something for me, y’know? Who gets my heart pounding, who… who makes me, uh… (begins to stare lovingly at Rachel)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: …little playthings with yarn?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Could you want her more?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Dee, the sarcastic sister from Whats Happening .

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, I am totally, totally over her, OK, I just… (Rachel comes over, Ross lays head on table): Hiiii!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi! How are you?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We’re fine, we’re fine.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK. (walks away)
(Ross keeps staring at her, head on table. Chandler smacks him with a newspaper. Joey enters, Ross and Chandler laugh at him.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Shut up!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We’re not—we’re not saying anything.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhhhh… Joey cried last night.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: We were playing poker, alright…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: There was chocolate on the three. It looked like an eight, alright?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, guys, you should’ve seen him. ’read ’em and weep.’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And then he did.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, now, how come you guys have never played poker with us?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, what is that? Like, some kind of guy thing? Like, some kind of sexist guy thing? Like it’s poker, so only guys can play?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, women are welcome to play.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, OK, so then what is it? Some kind of… you know, like, like… some kind of, y’know, like… alright, what is it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: There just don’t happen to be any women in our games.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, we just don’t happen to know any women that know how to play poker.

content.speaker: Girls
content.text: Oh, yeah, right.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, please, that is such a lame excuse!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Really.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I mean, that’s a typical guy response.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Excuse me, do any of you know how to play?

content.speaker: Girls
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But you could teach us.

content.speaker: Guys
content.text: No.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, the guys are teaching the girls how to play poker.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, so now we draw cards.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So I wouldn’t need any, right? Cause I have a straight.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, good for you!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Congratulations!
(Microwave timer goes off. Monica gets up.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK Phoebs, how many do you want?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, I just need two… the, um, ten of spades and the six of clubs.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No. No, uh, Phoebs? You can’t—you can’t do…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh wait, I have the ten of spades! Here! (gives it to Phoebe)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no. Uh… no, see, uh, you-you can’t do that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no, that’s OK, I don’t need them. I’m going for fours.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, you’re… (gives up)
(Monica comes back to the table with plates of food.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, here we go. We’ve got salmon roulettes and assorted crudites.

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: OOooooo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa, Monica, what’re you doin’? This is a poker game. You can’t serve food with more than one syllable. It’s gotta be like chips, or dip, or pretz…(look of realization)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, so at this point, the dealer…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, you know, we got it, we got it. Let’s play for real. High stakes… big bucks…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, now, you sure? Phoebe just threw away two jacks because they didn’t look happy…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But… I’m ready, so, just deal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: OK, alright, last minute lesson, last minute lesson. (holds up two cards) Joey… three… eight. Eight… three. (Joey is unamused) Alright babe, deal the cards.
(Time lapse.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Dammit, dammit, dammit!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: : Oh I see, so then, you were lying.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: About how good your cards were.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Heh… I was bluffing .

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: A-ha! And… what is bluffing? Is it not another word for… lying?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, sorry to break up this party, but I’ve got resumes to fax before work tomorrow… (gets up to leave)

content.speaker: Guys
content.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Rach, Rach, we gotta settle.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Settle what?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The… Jamestown colony of Virginia. You see, King George is giving us the land, so…

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: The game, Rachel, the game. You owe us money for the game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh. Right.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: You know what, you guys? It’s their first time, why don’t we just forget about the money, alright?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hell no, we’ll pay!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK, Monica? I had another answer all ready.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: And you know what? We want a rematch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well that’s fine with me. Could use the money.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : So basically, you get your ya-yas by taking money from all of your friends.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: …Yeah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, and I get my ya-yas from Ikea . You have to put them together yourself, but they cost a little less.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Look, Rachel, this is poker. I play to win, alright? In order for me to win, other people have to lose. So if you’re gonna play poker with me, don’t expect me to be a ‘nice guy,’ OK? Cause once those cards are dealt… (claps hands three times)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: …Yeah?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m not a nice guy.

content.description: Ross’ apartment. Chandler and Joey are there. Ross enters with a pizza.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright boys, let’s eat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, did you get that from the ‘I Love Rachel’ pizzeria?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You still on that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, come on. What was with that whole Black Bart speech? (mimicking): ”When I play poker, I’m not a nice guy!”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You are way off, pal.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, I don’t think so, see Ross, because I think you love her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Um… no. See, I might’ve had feelings for her at one time—not any more. I just—I…
(Marcel makes a screeching noise in background.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Marcel! Where are you going with that disc?
(Marcel puts a CD in the player.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You are not putting that on again! Marcel, OK—if you press that button, you are in very, very big trouble.
(The Lion Sleeps Tonight starts to play. Marcel starts to dance.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Rachel, Monica, and Phoebe are there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Can you believe what a jerk Ross was being?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah, I know. He can get really competitive.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ha. Ha, ha.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, hello, kettle? This is Monica. You’re black.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Please! I am not as bad as Ross.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I beg to differ. The Pictionary incident?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was not an incident! I-I was gesturing, a-and the plate slipped out of my hand.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oooooh. (reads letter) (surprised): Oh! I got an interview! I got an interview!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re kidding! Where? Where?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : Sak’s… Fifth… Avenue.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, Rachel!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s like the mother ship is calling you home.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, what’s the job?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Assistant buyer. Oh! I would be shopping… for a living!
(Knock on door.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, look. That is Aunt Iris. This woman has been playing poker since she was five. You gotta listen to every word she says. (opens door) Hi!

content.speaker: Aunt Iris
content.text: Is Tony Randall dead?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t think so.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Aunt Iris
content.text: Well, he may be now, because I think I hit him with my car.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Really?

content.speaker: Aunt Iris
content.text: No! That’s bluffing. Lesson number one. (walks into kitchen) Let me tell you something… everything you hear at a poker game is pure crap. (to Phoebe): Nice earrings.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thank y… (thinks about it)

content.speaker: Aunt Iris
content.text: Girls, sit down.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uh, Aunt Iris? This is Phoebe, and that’s Rachel…

content.speaker: Aunt Iris
content.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, listen, I am parked at a meter. Let’s do it.

content.description: [Scene: Ross’s apartment, everyone but Rachel is seated around his table. The Lion Sleep Tonight plays in the background.]

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross, could we please, please, please listen to anything else?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright.
(Ross shuts off the CD player. Marcel runs into the bedroom and slams the door.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m gonna pay for that tonight.
(Knock on door. Ross opens it. Rachel enters.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Guys! Guess what, guess what, guess what, guess what!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Um, ok… the… the fifth dentist caved and now they’re all recommending Trident ?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Noooo… the interview! She loved me! She absolutely loved me. We talked for like two and a half hours, we have the same taste in clothes, and—oh, I went to camp with her cousin… And, oh, the job is perfect. I can do this. I can do this well!

content.speaker: All
content.text: That’s great! That’s wonderful!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh God, oh, and then she told the funniest story…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, great. You’ll tell us and we’ll laugh. Let’s play poker.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright now listen, you guys, we talked about it, and if you don’t want to play, we completely understand.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yes, yes, we could play some other game… like, uh, I don’t know… Pictionary ?
(The guys all duck under the table.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ha, ha, very funny, very funny. But I think we’d like to give poker another try. Shall we, ladies?

content.speaker: Phoebe and Rachel
content.text: Yes, we should. I think we should.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Rach, do you want me to shuffle those?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No, no, thats OK. Y’know, I think I’m gonna give it a go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright… (shuffles cards expertly, all the guys stare in amazement)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, Phoebs owes $7.50, Monica, you owe $10, and Rachel, you owe fifteen big ones.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But hey, thanks for teachin’ us Cross-Eyed Mary. You guys, we gotta play that at our regular game.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, here’s my $7.50. (Hands them the money) But I think you should know that this money is cursed.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I cursed it. So now bad things will happen to he who spends it.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s alright, I’ll take it. Bad things happen to me anyway. This way I can break ’em up with a movie.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, that just leaves the big Green poker machine, who owes fifteen…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Mmm-hmmm. Oh, so typical. Ooo, I’m a man. Ooo, I have a penis. Ooo, I have to win money to exert my power over women. (hands over her money)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? This is not over. We will play you again, and we will win, and you will lose, and you will beg, and we will laugh, and we will take every last dime you have, and you will hate yourselves forever .

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm. Kinda stepped on my point there, Mon.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, everyone is there ready for another poker game.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, you gals wanna hand over your money now? That way, we don’t have to go through the formality of actually playing.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooooh, that’s fine. We’ll see who has the last laugh there, monkey boy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, we done with the chit-chat? Are we ready to play some serious poker?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey you guys, look, the one-eyed jack follows me wherever I go. (they look at her) Right, OK, serious poker.
content.parenthetical: holding a card and waving it in front of her face

content.text: (Ross gets up from the table.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Excuse me, where are you going?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh… to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you want to go to the bathroom, or do you wanna play poker?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I want to go to the bathroom. (exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Alright, well, I’m gonna order a pizza. (gets up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no-no-no-no-no, I’m still waiting to hear from that job and the store closes at nine, so you can eat then.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s fine. I’ll just have a Tic-Tac to hold me over.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, Cincinnati, no blinds, everybody ante. (deals cards)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes! (everyone looks at her) … or no.
(Ross comes back from bathroom.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright. (to Rachel): Your money’s mine, Green.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Your fly is open, Geller. (he checks it, and zips up)
(Time lapse.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, you know what I just realized? ‘Joker’ is ‘poker’ with a ‘J.’ Coincidence?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, that’s… that’s ‘joincidence’ with a ‘C’!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh… Phoebe? Phoebe?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. Um… I’m out. (throws in cards)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m in.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Me too. Alright, whattaya got.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, you better hop outta the shower, cause… I gotta flush. (lays down cards)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, well, well, hop back in bucko, cause I got four sixes! (lays down cards) I won! I actually won! Oh my God! Y’know what? (collects chips) I think I’m gonna make a little Ross pile. (holds up a chip) I think that one was Ross’s, and I think—oh—that one was Ross’s. Yes! (Starts singing): Well, I have got your money, and you’ll never see it …
(Ross stands up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And your fly’s still open…
(Ross looks down.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ha, I made you look…
(Time lapse.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I couldn’t be inner. Monica?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Monica, in or out?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hate this game!
(Joey slides a plate away from Monica towards Chandler, who hides it under the table.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: OK Joey, your bet.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhh, I fold like a cheap hooker who got hit in the stomach by a fat guy with sores on his face. (the girls look at him, confused) Oh, I’m out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ross?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, I am very in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Couldn’t be more out. (throws in cards)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Me too. Rachel.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uh, I will see you… and I’ll raise you. (throws chips in pot) What do you say… want to waste another buck?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, not this time. (he folds) So… what’d you have?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I’m not telling. (collects chips)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Come on, show them to me. (reaches for her cards, Rachel covers them up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No..!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Show them to me!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Get your hands out of there! No!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let me see! Show them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know, I’ve had dates like this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Boy, you really can’t stand to lose, can you? Your whole face is getting red… little veins popping out on your temple…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Plus that shirt doesn’t really match those pants.
(Ross is visibly upset.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: First of all, I’m not losing…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, you are losing. Definitely losing. (phone rings)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Let’s not talk about losing. Just deal the…

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hel-lo, Rachel Green.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mee mee, mee-mee mee.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Excuse me. (covers up phone; to Ross) It’s about the job .
(Rachel walks into kitchen to talk on the phone.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Barbara! Hi, how are you? (Listens) Uh-huh. (Listens) No, I understand. Yeah. Oh, oh, come on, no, I’m fine. Don’t be silly. Yeah… oh, but you know, if-if anything else opens up, plea—Hello? Hello? (hangs up phone, very depressed)
(Rachel goes back and sits down. The rest don’t know what to say.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sorry, Rach.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know, there’s gonna be lots of other stuff.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah…(sigh)…OK. Where were we? Oh, OK… five card draw, uh… jacks or better… nothing wild, everybody ante.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, Rachel, we don’t have to do this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes, we do. (pause)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Alright, check.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Check.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m in for fifty cents. (throws it in)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Call.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m in.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I see your fifty cents… and I raise you… five dollars. (throws it in)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I thought, uh… it was a fifty cent limit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I just lost a job, and I’d like to raise the bet five bucks. Does anybody have a problem with that?
(Everyone says no and folds, except for Ross, who thinks about it.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : Loser?
(Chandler, Monica, Joey, and Phoebe back their chairs away from the table.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, I fold. (lays cards down, and gets up)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What do you mean, you fold? Hey, come on! What is this? I thought that ‘once the cards were dealt, I’m not a nice guy.’ I mean, what, were you just full of it?
(Ross thinks it over, finally sits down and picks up his cards.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m in. (throws in chips)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How many you want?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: One. (Rachel gives him the card.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Dealer takes two. (she deals herself two cards) What do you bet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I bet two dollars. (throws it in)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK… see your two… and I raise you twenty. (throws it in)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I see your twenty, raise you twenty-five. (throws it in)
(The other four look amazed at the large pot.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: See your twenty-five…and…uh, Monica, get my purse.
(Monica gets up, looks in Rachel’s purse.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Rachel, there’s nothing in it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, then get me your purse.
(Monica gets Rachel her purse.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: OK, here you go. Good luck.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: : Thank you. (to Ross): I saw your twenty-five, and I raise you… seven.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: …teen! (throws in a ten-dollar bill)
(Ross looks in his wallet, pulls out two dollars.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: : Joey, I’m a little shy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s OK, Ross, you can ask me. What?
(Ross looks at Joey, dumbfounded at his stupidity.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: : What do you need, what do you need?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Fifteen.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, here’s ten. (gives it to him)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here, I got five, I got five. (Ross takes the money)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thank you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good luck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: : OK, I am calling your seventeen. What do you got?
(Long pause as they both look at each other.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Full house.
(Ross stares at her. Thinks about it. Puts cards on table, face down.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You got me.
(Monica and Phoebe get up and start celebrating in the kitchen, pouring wine and singing. Rachel, shocked, goes to join them.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: : Ahhh, that’s alright. Y’know, that’s a tough hand to beat.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: : I thought we had them!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, well, when you don’t have the cards, you don’t have the cards, you know. (looks at Rachel) But, uh… look how happy she is. (smiles)
(Chandler and Joey look at her, and then look back at him. They dive for Ross’s hand to see what he had, and he tries to stop them from looking.)

content.description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel’s, all six are playing Pictionary at Monica’s apartment. Monica is drawing a picture, and the three guys are guessing. She draws what looks like an airplane.]

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Airplane ! Airport ! Airport ‘75 ! Airport ‘77 ! Airport ‘79 !
(Timer goes off.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, time’s up.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye… bye… BIRDIE .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a bird?
(Monica glares at Phoebe.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a bird !
(Monica sits, Rachel gets up.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: OK, OK, it’s my turn. (reads the answer)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Go.
(Rachel starts drawing what looks like a bean.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh… bean! Bean!
(Rachel begins tapping the picture of the bean frantically.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: The Unbearable Likeness of Being !

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That , you get? That , you get?
(Monica picks up a glass to take a drink, everyone ducks as though she was about to throw it.)
